content.description:
The crux hits quick, right after the third bolt, then a little balancy and reachy above that. 

  NOTE: PLEASE WAIT A DAY OR TWO TO CLIMB AFTER A RAIN!!
content.location: This is the fifth route on the South (left) wall after the rock scramble up to gain the Dr's Office proper

content.description:
The crux comes after the 5th bolt and stays continuously hard, off-balance and pumpy until just below the last bolt. 

  This is a very clean, quality route - the best rock on the wall. 

  NOTE: PLEASE WAIT A DAY OR TWO TO CLIMB AFTER A RAIN!!
content.location: This is the second route on the South (left) side of the Dr's Office after the scramble up the rocks to gain the Office proper.

content.description: This is the Left variation to House Calls. The crux hits just after leaving House Calls.
content.location: This is a variation on House Calls, the first route on the North (right) side of the Dr's Office

content.description: The crux is a long move right after the 4th? bolt, then a tricky mantel move.
content.location:
This is the fourth route on the South (left) side of the Dr's Office after the rock scramble to gain the Office proper. 

  NOTE: PLEASE WAIT A DAY OR TWO TO CLIMB AFTER A RAIN!!

content.description: This is the mossy OW that forms the left side of the ascent gully into the Pharmacy. Originally done just to get up there, there is now a iron ladder and rap station, rendering this climb somewhat obsolete,but for the ow afficionado, it's pretty good.

There are two seperate 5.11+ cruxes, one after the 5th bolt and another after the 7th bolt at the roof. The finish is steep .10c for 20 feet on amazing slopey melon-like holds! 

  NOTE: PLEASE WAIT A DAY OR TWO TO CLIMB AFTER A RAIN!!
content.location: This is the third route on the South (left) side of the Doctor's office after the rock scramble to gain the Office proper

content.description: The initial moves to get to the rebar rungs are 5.8
content.protection: There is a rope hanging on this approach route to protect self-belay the moves
content.location: This is the "Via Ferrata" rebar ladder that gains The Pharmacy.

content.description: This whole thing seems cruxy! A delicate bolt-protected slab/dihedral, one is glad there are many bolts!
content.location: This is the first bolted route on the North (right) side after the rock-scramble to gain the Dr's Office proper.

content.description: The Doctor's Office is a narrow corridor between two large fins of rock that houses a bunch of fairly new bolted lines (and a few trad and mixed lines as well). The Pharmacy is the upper part of the same corridor (blocked off by a huge chockstone) that is easily accessed via a rebar ladder. The southern wall is generally vertical to slightly overhanging and offers pocketed and edgey sandstone climbing on less than perfect rock. The northern wall has mostly slabby climbing on black rock. This area gets all day shade and remains cool even in the summer heat.
